resources.string: The URL to connect to openHAB (eg http://openhab:8080)
Use Basic Authentication to connect to openHAB?
You need to select a sitemap
Please configure this app and set the base URL for openHAB
An error occurred while sending the command: {0}
Can\'t authenticate with openHAB, please configure valid username and password
Can\'t connect to the openHAB host? Is openHAB running?
The connection to openHAB timed out
Try to use WebSockets to receive realtime updates of openHAB items?

Some widgets like Setpoint or Slider can cause many commands to be send in a very short time frame. Especially on my mobile networks this can become quite problem. This lets you configure a delay for sending commands. Only the last command after the delay has passed will be send.
This wizard will help you to configure HABSweetie so it can connect to your openHAB instance.
First please choose a name for your openHAB instance. Something like "Home" or "Weekend Flat".
Configure here how HABSweetie should connect if you are connected to your home WiFi.

Configure the internal URL of your openHAB instance. This is mostly something like http://openhab:8080 or http://192.168.1.10:8080. It is important to specify a complete URL with protocol prefix without the trailing slash.

Some people experienced problems when using WebSockets to communicate with openHAB. If you are sure that WebSockets will work you can activate them here. But HABSweetie will also work well with the other means of communication.
Do you need a username and password to connect to openHAB?
Configure here how HABSweetie should connect if you are not at home.
Configure the external URL of your openHAB instance. Most certainly you will enter here a DynDNS address.
